sanskrit_verse:
अधियज्ञं ब्रह्म जपेदाधिदैविकमेव च ।
आध्यात्मिकं च सततं वेदान्ताभिहितं च यत् ॥ ६.८३॥
transliteration:
adhiyajñaṃ brahma japēd ādhidaivikam ēva ca |
ādhyātmikaṃ ca satataṃ vēdāntābhihitaṃ ca yat || 6.83||
sph_interpretive_translation: One shall constantly recite the Brahman that presides over sacrifice, as also that which is divine in the Vedas, and that which is declared in the Upanishads as pertaining to the Self.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in alignment with the presiding consciousness of action
Causation flows from invocation of the presiding divinity of intent
Capacity-based responsibility arises through sustained alignment with Vedic authority
Restoration logic operates through repetition and reconnection to foundational truths
Consciousness alignment is achieved via recitation and resonance with revealed knowledge
executable_legal_axioms: IF an individual performs ritual or civic duty, THEN they MUST invoke the presiding consciousness of that domain to maintain lawful alignment
IF a person engages in public discourse or jurisprudence, THEN they MUST align with the Vedantic Self-principle to preserve truth-value
IF consciousness dissonance is detected in legal actor, THEN initiate recitation protocol until alignment is restored
IF societal harmony falters, THEN assess collective invocation frequency of Adhiyajña, Adhidaivika, and Atman principles
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court deliberations, invocation of the presiding consciousness—Adhiyajña, Adhidaivika, and Adhyatmika—is mandatory for constitutional alignment. The court must affirm its rulings through Vedantic Self-reference to ensure lawful authority. Dissonance in judgment indicates misalignment requiring immediate corrective recitation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality establishes that lawful action originates from invocation of the presiding divinity. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential alignment: first ritual (Adhiyajña), then cosmic order (Adhidaivika), then Self-realization (Atman). Responsibility is proportional to alignment depth; non-punitive correction occurs through recitation and re-alignment, not penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate daily recitation of the threefold Brahman until societal resonance is restored
Assign judicial officers to Vedic study protocols to realign capacity for truth-discernment
Implement collective chanting in legislative assemblies to restore constitutional consciousness
Establish weekly review of invocation compliance among civic leaders to prevent systemic dissonance
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law restores alignment with the presiding consciousness of action, affirms the supremacy of Vedic authority, and confirms that justice is consciousness-resonant, non-punitive, and eternally self-correcting.
